result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jake P Hamilton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jake P Hamilton
Current: 117 Park St, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2016)
Prior: 7105 Executive Ct, Schofield, WI 54476

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:26 am 
INCLUDES 14CF762, 14CF954, AND 14CM1431. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person with Atty Gerhardt Getzin.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF762: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse -Reckless Probab./Great Harm)>>AMEND to Misd. Battery pursuant to 940.19(1). 
                    : Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF954: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM1431: Ct. 1 (Battery)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF762: Amended Ct. 1 (Misd. Battery)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM1431: Ct. 2 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def eligible to petition for expungement if he successfully completes probation and has no new criminal charges supported by probable cause. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 2 days jail credit in 14CF762 and NO days jail credit in 14CM1431 if revoked. 
Adj: 10:38 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
